title: order
description: An order to be communicated from master control to the AGV.

orderUpdateId.title: orderUpdateId
orderUpdateId.description: orderUpdate identification. Is unique per orderId. If an order update is rejected, this field is to be passed in the rejection message.

zoneSetId.title: zoneSetId
zoneSetId.description:
Unique identifier of the zone set that the AGV has to use for navigation or that was used by MC for planning.
Optional: Some MC systems do not use zones. Some AGVs do not understand zones. Do not add to message if no zones are used.

nodes.title: List of Nodes
nodes.description: This list holds the base and the horizon nodes of the order graph.

nodeId.title: nodeId
nodeId.description: Unique node identification. For example: pumpenhaus_1, MONTAGE

sequenceId.title: sequenceId
sequenceId.description:
Id to track the sequence of nodes and edges in an order and to simplify order updates.
The main purpose is to distinguish between a node which is passed more than once within one orderId. The variable sequenceId can run across all nodes and edges of the same order and is reset when a new orderId is issued.

released.title: released
released.description: If true, the edge is part of the base plan. If false, the edge is part of the horizon plan.

nodePosition.description: Defines the position on a map in world coordinates. Each floor has its own map. Precision is up to the specific implementation.

actions.title: actions
actions.description: Array of actions that are to be executed on the node. Their sequence in the list governs their sequence of execution.

actionType.title: actionType
actionType.description:
Enum of actions as described in the first column of "Actions and Parameters"
Identifies the function of the action.

actionId.title: actionId
actionId.description: ID to distinguish between multiple actions with the same type on the same node.

blockingType.description:
Regulates if the action is allowed to be executed during movement and/or parallel to other actions.
none: action can happen in parallel with others, including movement.
soft: action can happen simultaneously with others, but not while moving.
hard: no other actions can be performed while this action is running.

actionParameters.description: Array of actionParameter-objects for the indicated action e. g. deviceId, loadId, external Triggers.

edges.title: edges
edges.description: Base and Horizon Edges of the Order Graph.

sequenceId.title: sequenceId
sequenceId.description: Id to track the sequence of nodes and edges in an order and to simplify order updates. The variable sequenceId runs across all nodes and edges of the same order and is reset when a new orderId is issued.

released.title: released
released.description: If true, the edge is part of the base plan. If false, the edge is part of the horizon plan.

startNodeId.title: startNodeId
startNodeId.description: The nodeId of the start node.

endNodeId.title: endNodeId
endNodeId.description: The nodeId of the end node.

maxSpeed.title: maxSpeed
maxSpeed.description: permitted maximum speed of the agv on the edge in m/s. Speed is defined by the fastest point of the vehicle.

maxHeight.title: maxHeight
maxHeight.description: Permitted maximum height of the vehicle, including the load, on edge. In meters.

minHeight.title: minHeight
minHeight.description: Permitted minimal height of the edge measured at the bottom of the load. In meters.

orientation.title: orientation
orientation.description:
Orientation of the AGV on the edge relative to the map coordinate origin (for holonomic vehicles with more than one driving direction).
Example: orientation Pi/2 rad will lead to a rotation of 90 degrees.
If AGV starts in different orientation, rotate the vehicle on the edge to the desired orientation if rotationAllowed is set to "true".
If rotationAllowed is "false", rotate before entering the edge.
If that is not possible, reject the order.
If a trajectory with orientation is defined, follow the trajectories orientation. If a trajectory without orientation and the orientation field here is defined, apply the orientation to the tangent of the trajectory.

direction.title: direction
direction.description: Sets direction at junctions for line-guided vehicles, to be defined initially (vehicle-individual). Can be descriptive (left, right, middle, straight) or a frequency ("433MHz").

rotationAllowed.title: rotationAllowed
rotationAllowed.description: If true, rotation is allowed on the edge.

distance.title: distance
distance.description: Distance of the path from startNode to endNode in meters. This value is used by line-guided AGVs to decrease their speed before reaching a stop position.

trajectory.description:
Trajectory JSON-object for this edge as a NURBS. Defines the curve on which the AGV should move between startNode and endNode.
Optional: Can be omitted if AGV cannot process trajectories or if AGV plans its own trajectory.

actions.title: Actions
actions.description: Array of action objects with detailed information.

actionType.title: actionType
actionType.description:
Enum of actions as described in the first column of "Actions and Parameters"
Identifies the function of the action.

actionId.title: actionId
actionId.description: ID to distinguish between multiple actions with the same name on the same node.

actionParameters.description: Array of actionParameter-objects for the indicated action e. g. deviceId, loadId, external Triggers.
